messages.message: anyone notice git commands run super slowly now? did somebody check in a bunch of stuff?
like git grep now takes forever
Seems normal to me at the moment… I haven’t used `git grep` before though — just the basic fetch/rebase/commit/push/log/etc. things

I haven't noticed any slowdown  with git, but I would like to take a moment to recommend using The Silver Searcher (binary name: `ag`) instead of either `git grep` , ack, or regular grep. It works even outside of git repos, is blazing fast (it automatically skips `.git` directories, as well as anything listed in `.gitignore` among other things), and allows you to do stuff like  `ag --python foo` to recursively search only python files for foo. Install it on any mac with `brew install the_silver_searcher`  . Another alternative is ripgrep (`rg`) which is even faster, but it doesn't have the built-in file-type support which is really just super nice.
@lydia kind of a long-shot for optimization but if other people aren’t running into the same thing have you tried `git gc` ?
